benchmark_details.name: AutoG: Towards Automatic Graph Construction from Tabular Data
benchmark_details.overview: This work addresses the challenges in graph construction from tabular data by establishing a formal problem and proposing a set of datasets designed for evaluating graph construction methods and an automatic generation solution.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To formalize the graph construction problem and evaluate different methods for automatic graph generation from tabular data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The automatic generation process currently addresses only moderately complex scenarios.

data.source: Datasets extracted from Kaggle and existing datasets focused on tabular data.
data.size: 8 datasets covering diverse graph construction challenges
data.annotation: Datasets have been prepared to reflect real-world graph construction challenges without expert pre-processing.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of graph construction methods applied to defined tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance metrics indicate better graph construction effectiveness.
methodology.baseline_results: AutoG outperforms existing heuristic-based graph construction methods and approaches human-level performance.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted across multiple datasets to verify results.
